In the Roman calendar, March 15 was known as the [[Ides of March]].

==Events==
*[[44 BC]] &ndash; [[Julius Caesar]], [[Roman dictator|Dictator]] of the [[Roman Republic]], is [[Assassination of Julius Caesar|stabbed to death]] by [[Marcus Junius Brutus]], [[Gaius Cassius Longinus]], [[Decimus Junius Brutus Albinus|Decimus Junius Brutus]] and several other [[Roman Senate|Roman senators]] on the [[Ides of March]].
* [[221]] &ndash; [[Liu Bei]], a [[China|Chinese]] [[warlord]] and member of the Han royal house, declares himself [[emperor]] of [[Shu-Han]] and claims his legitimate [[Order of succession|succession]] to the [[Han Dynasty]].
* [[280]] &ndash; [[Sun Hao]] of [[Eastern Wu]] surrenders to [[Sima Yan]] which began the Jin Dynasty.
* [[351]] &ndash; [[Constantius II]] elevates his cousin [[Constantius Gallus|Gallus]] to [[Caesar (title)|Caesar]], and puts him in charge of the Eastern part of the [[Roman Empire]].
* [[933]] &ndash; After a ten-year truce, [[Germany|German]] King [[Henry I of Germany|Henry I]] defeats a [[Hungary|Hungarian]] army at the [[Battle of Riade]] near the [[Unstrut]] river.
*[[1311]] &ndash; [[Battle of Halmyros]]: The [[Catalan Company]] defeats [[Walter V of Brienne]] to take control of the [[Duchy of Athens]], a [[Crusader states|Crusader state]] in [[Greece]].
*[[1493]] &ndash; [[Christopher Columbus]] returns to [[Spain]] after his first trip to the [[Americas]].
*[[1545]] &ndash; First meeting of the [[Council of Trent]].
*[[1564]] &ndash; Mughal [[Akbar the Great|Emperor Akbar]] abolishes "[[jizya]]" (''per capita'' tax).
*[[1672]] &ndash; [[Charles II of England]] issues the [[Royal Declaration of Indulgence]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Battle of Guilford Courthouse]] &ndash; Near present-day [[Greensboro, North Carolina|Greensboro]], [[North Carolina]], 1,900 [[United Kingdom|British]] troops under General [[Charles Cornwallis]] defeat an American force numbering 4,400.
*[[1783]] &ndash; In an emotional speech in [[Newburgh, New York]], [[George Washington]] asks his officers not to support the [[Newburgh Conspiracy]]. The plea is successful and the threatened [[coup d'état]] never takes place.
*[[1820]] &ndash; [[Maine]] becomes the 23rd [[U.S. state]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; A [[Hungarian Revolution of 1848|revolution breaks out in Hungary]]. The [[Habsburg]] rulers are compelled to meet the demands of the Reform party.
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Red River Campaign]] : U.S. Navy fleet arrives at [[Alexandria, Louisiana]].
*[[1874]] &ndash; [[French Third Republic|France]] and [[Nguyễn Dynasty|Viet Nam]] sign the [[Second Treaty of Saigon]], further recognizing the full sovereignty of France over [[Cochinchina]].
*[[1875]] &ndash; [[Archbishop of New York]] [[John McCloskey]] is named the first [[cardinal (Catholicism)|cardinal]] in the United States.
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[First ever official cricket test match is played]]: Australia vs England at the [[MCG Stadium]], in [[Melbourne]], Australia.
*[[1888]] &ndash; Start of the [[Sikkim Expedition|Anglo-Tibetan War of 1888]].
*[[1892]] &ndash; [[Liverpool F.C.]] is founded.
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Rolls-Royce Limited]] is incorporated.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Woodrow Wilson]] sends 4,800 United States troops over the [[U.S.-Mexico border]] to [[Pancho Villa Expedition|pursue]] [[Pancho Villa]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[Tsar]] [[Nicholas II of Russia]] abdicates the [[Russia]]n throne and his brother the Grand Duke becomes Tsar.
*[[1922]] &ndash; After [[Egypt]] gains nominal independence from the United Kingdom, [[Fuad I of Egypt|Fuad I]] becomes [[King of Egypt]].
*[[1926]] &ndash; The dictator [[Theodoros Pangalos (general)|Theodoros Pangalos]] is elected President of Greece without opposition.
*[[1931]] &ndash; {{SS|Viking}} explodes off [[Newfoundland and Labrador|Newfoundland]], killing 27 of the 147 on board.
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Austria]]n Chancellor [[Engelbert Dollfuss]] keeps members of the [[National Council of Austria|National Council]] from convening, starting the [[austrofascism|austrofascist]] dictatorship.
*[[1935]] &ndash; [[Percy Shaw]] founded his company Reflecting Roadstuds Limited to make [[cat's eye (road)|cat's eye]]s.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Nazi Germany|German]] troops occupy the remaining part of [[Bohemia]] and [[Moravia]]; [[Czechoslovakia]] ceases to exist.
*  1939   &ndash; [[Carpatho-Ukraine]] declares itself an independent republic, but is annexed by [[Hungary]] the next day.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[Philippine Airlines]], the flag carrier of the [[Philippines]] takes its first flight between [[Manila]] (from [[Nielson Field]]) to [[Baguio|Baguio City]] with a [[Beechcraft Model 18]] making the airline the first and oldest commercial airline in [[Asia]] operating under its original name.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[Third Battle of Kharkov]] &ndash; the Germans retake the city of [[Kharkov]] from the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] armies in bitter street fighting.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: Soviet forces begin an [[Upper Silesian Offensive|offensive]] to push Germans from [[Upper Silesia]].
*[[1952]] &ndash; In [[Cilaos]], [[Réunion]], 1870&nbsp;mm (73&nbsp;inches) of [[rain]] falls in a 24-hour period, setting a new world record (March 15 through March 16).
*[[1956]] &ndash; ''[[My Fair Lady]]'' receives its premiere performance on Broadway at the Mark Hellinger Theatre.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[South Africa]] withdraws from the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]], responding to the [[Selma, Alabama|Selma]] crisis, tells [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] "We shall overcome" while advocating the [[Voting Rights Act]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Somalia]] and [[Ethiopia]] signed a truce to end the [[Ethiopian-Somali War]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; The first [[Internet]] [[domain name]] is registered ([[symbolics]].com).
*  1985   &ndash; [[Brazilian military dictatorship]] ends.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Hotel New World Disaster]]: Thirty-three people die when the Hotel New World in Singapore collapses.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Mikhail Gorbachev]] is elected as the first [[President of the Soviet Union]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Treaty on the Final Settlement with Respect to Germany]] comes into effect, granting full sovereignty to the [[Federal Republic of Germany]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; Beginning of the [[Syrian civil war]].
